summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff and defense attorney Michael C. Miller regarding document requests from Jeffrey Epstein's legal team in his criminal case. The emails discuss routing the requests to the civil division and coordinating service on the MCC and FBI.

events.title: Epstein Defense Submits Document Requests
events.description: Defense attorney Michael C. Miller sends document request letters to the SDNY, MCC, and FBI in the criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: On August 20, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein's defense team, led by Michael C. Miller, submitted formal document requests to the SDNY, MCC, and FBI.
The email chain shows internal SDNY coordination about whether to route the defense requests to the civil division.
The defense proposed that the SDNY accept service for all three request letters (to SDNY, MCC, and FBI) to streamline the process.
The criminal case is identified as United States v. Jeffrey Epstein, 19-CRIM-00490 (S.D.N.Y.).
Epstein's legal team included Michael C. Miller, Reid Weingarten, and Martin G. Weinberg at this stage.
